ARABIC: قُلْ أَفَغَيْرَ ٱللَّهِ تَأْمُرُوٓنِّىٓ أَعْبُدُ أَيُّهَا ٱلْجَٰهِلُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Say: 'Do you order me to worship something other than Allah, you ignorant people?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Say: "O you ignorant people, do you bid me to worship someone other than God?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: (O Prophet), say: “Ignorant people! Do you bid me to serve any other beside Allah?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: (Muhammad), say, "Ignorant ones, do you command me to worship things other than God
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Say (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him) “So do you instruct me to worship (deities) other than Allah? You ignorant fools!”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Say: "Do you order me to worship other than Allah O you fools!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Say: What! Do you then bid me serve others than Allah, O ignorant men?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Say: 'Is it other than God you bid me serve, you ignorant ones?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Say (O Muhammad, to the disbelievers): Do ye bid me serve other than Allah? O ye fools!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Say, "Ignorant men! Would you bid me worship someone other than God?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Say thou: is it other than Allah that ye command me to worship! O ye pagans
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Say, ‘Will you, then, bid me to worship other than Allah, O you ignorant ones?!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Say: "Is it some one other than Allah that ye order me to worship, O ye ignorant ones?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Say (O Muhammad SAW to the polytheists, etc.): "Do you order me to worship other than Allah O you fools?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Say: 'O you who are ignorant, is it other than Allah that you would order me to worship'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Say, “Is it other than God you instruct me to worship, you ignorant ones?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Say, [O Muhammad], "Is it other than Allah that you order me to worship, O ignorant ones?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [39:64] Say: ‘Is it [something] other than God that you bid me to worship, O you who are ignorant?’ (ghayra is in the accusative because of [the verb] a‘budu, ‘I worship’, which itself is operated by ta’murūnī, ‘you bid me’,   read with one nūn on the basis of an implicit an; it [ta’murūnī] may also be read with two nūns assimilated [ta’murūnnī] or separated [ta’murūnanī]).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Say) Muhammad, to the people of Mecca when they said: revert to the religion of your forefathers: (Do ye bid me serve) do you bid me to follow (other than Allah) other than Allah's religion? (0 ye fools) you miscreants! 537
